Prince Andrew always became specially keen when he had to guide a young man and help him to worldly success. Under cover of obtain- ing help of this kind for another, which from pride he would never accept for himself, he kept in touch with the circle which confers suc- cess and which attracted him. He very readily took up Boris' cause and went with him to Dol- goriikov. 
It was late in the evening when they entered the palace at Olmiitz occupied by the Emper- ors a
